intro: Tetraria arundinacea, commonly known as the common tetraria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, cylindrical stems that are often reddish in color. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small yellow flowers in composite clusters. Tetraria arundinacea is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
